document.docAuthor: Srinivasan, Pandiarajan, Sivaruban, T., Barathy, S. & Isack, Rajasekaran
document.docTitle: Sparsorythus srokai Srinivasan & Sivaruban & Barathy & Isack 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Sparsorythus Sroka & Soldán, 2008 (Ephemeroptera: Tricorythidae) from Tamil Nadu, India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Sparsorythus Sroka & Soldán, 2008 (Ephemeroptera: Tricorythidae) from Tamil Nadu, India

mods:name.mods:affiliation: PG & Research department of Zoology, The American College, Madurai- 625002, India.
PG & Research department of Zoology, The American College, Madurai- 625002, India.
Department of Zoology, Fatima College, Madurai- 625018, India.
PG & Research department of Zoology, The American College, Madurai- 625002, India.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types.
Holotype
(in alcohol): Female mature nymph ( Reg. No. ZSI–SRC/I/E/597), South India , Tamil Nadu , Theni district , Veerapandi River , 9.9663 N & 77.4353 E ,
308 m
a.s.l;
21/i/2021
, P. Srinivasan & R . Isack leg.
Paratypes
: 1 female nymph (Reg. No. ZSI–SRC/I/E/598),
1 male nymph ( AMC ZN 190 ) and
6 female nymphs ( AMC ZN 191 ), same data as holotype
.

Diagnosis. The nymphs of
Sparsorythus srokai
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from all other species of
Sparsorythus
by the following combination of characters: i) presence of lateral setae in the each segment of caudal filaments ( Fig. 3I ), ii) dorsal surface of labrum entirely covered with scattered ribbon-like bristles ( Fig. 2A& 2B ), iii) posterior margin of mesonotum reaching segment III in both sexes ( Fig. 1A ), and iv) left prostheca with several pointed teeth apically ( Fig. 2G ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Nymph of
Sparsorythus srokai
sp. nov.

FIGURE 2. Mouthparts of
Sparsorythus srokai
sp. nov.
A, Labrum; B, Ribbon-like bristles in labrum; C, Hypopharyngeal lingua; D, Maxilla; E, Labium; F, Left mandible; G, SEM view of left prostheca; H, Three to four bristle-like processes at base of left prostheca; I, Right mandible; J, SEM view of right prostheca.

FIGURE 3. Nymph of
Sparsorythus srokai
sp. nov.
A, Foreleg; B, Midleg; C, Hindleg; D, Transverse setae on forefemur; E, SEM view of bristle like foretibial setae; F, Shape of midtibial setae; G, Different shaped setae in the surface of hindfemur; H, Gill II; I, SEM view of proximal part of paracercus and cerci; J, SEM view of egg; K, SEM view of chorionic surface of egg.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . This species is dedicated to Dr. Pavel Sroka for his contribution to Oriental Tricorythidae .

Ecology. The nymphs of
Sparsorythus srokai
sp. nov.
were collected in the River of Veerapandi, Theni district ( 6–12 m wide, about 10 cm depth). The water temperature ranges between 25°C–28°C and pH 7.2–7.6.
